Key Match Events: Steph Curry scored a season-high 36 points on 13-of-23 shooting from the field with seven made 3-pointers in 37 minutes.
Curry added seven assists, five rebounds and a steal in Golden State's impressive 127-116 win over the Thunder on Sunday night.
In the third quarter, Curry caught fire, scoring 17 of his 36 points on 7-of-10 shooting.
Later in the fourth quarter, with the Thunder threatening a late comeback, Curry came into the game to bury a pair of clutch 3-pointers to ice the game for the Warriors.
Others: Sunday marked Curry's first 30-point performance of the season.
Curry will now prepare to face his former teammate and Splash Brother Klay Thompson in his highly-anticipated return to the Bay Area with the Dallas Mavericks on Tuesday night at Chase Center.
